turns.content: What is an inverter convertor combo for a 30 amp rv that is similar to the Victron Multiplus?

The Victron Multiplus is a popular inverter/charger combo for RVs, which is capable of converting DC power from your battery bank to AC power for your RV's electrical needs, as well as charging your batteries when connected to shore power or a generator.

If you're looking for a similar inverter/charger combo for a 30 amp RV, some other options to consider include:

1. Xantrex Freedom SW Inverter/Charger - This is a high-quality inverter/charger combo that is capable of delivering up to 3000 watts of continuous power, and comes with a built-in transfer switch for seamless switching between AC power sources.
2. Magnum Energy MS Series Inverter/Charger - This is another popular option for RVers, offering high-quality pure sine wave output and an integrated battery charger capable of delivering up to 125 amps of charging power.
3. AIMS Power Inverter/Charger - AIMS is a well-known brand in the RV and off-grid communities, offering a wide range of inverter/charger combos suitable for various applications. Their 3000 watt inverter/charger combo is a popular choice for RVers looking for a reliable and affordable solution.

Ultimately, the best inverter/charger combo for your specific needs will depend on your power requirements, budget, and other factors. Be sure to carefully evaluate your options and choose a unit that is well-suited to your RV and your specific power needs.
How many watt hours is 200 amp hours at 24 volts?

To calculate the watt hours for 200 amp hours at 24 volts, you can use the formula:

Watt hours = Amp hours x Volts

So, for 200 amp hours at 24 volts, the calculation would be:

Watt hours = 200 Ah x 24 V = 4,800 Wh

Therefore, 200 amp hours at 24 volts is equivalent to 4,800 watt hours.
What's the product name for the 3000 watt 12 volt Victron Multiplus?
The product name for the 3000 watt 12 volt Victron Multiplus is "Victron MultiPlus 12/3000/120-50 120V VE.Bus Inverter/Charger".
does that model have an automatic transfer switch?

Yes, the Victron MultiPlus 12/3000/120-50 120V VE.Bus Inverter/Charger comes with an automatic transfer switch (ATS) built-in. The ATS allows the MultiPlus to automatically switch between different power sources, such as shore power, generator power, and battery power, based on the available power sources and the user's configuration settings. This ensures that your RV or other off-grid system always has a reliable source of power and helps to prevent power outages or interruptions.
I just looked up the Champion you suggested but it doesn't look like the 2000 watt model has remote start.

I apologize for the confusion. You are correct that the Champion 2000-Watt Ultralight Portable Inverter Generator does not have a remote start capability. I apologize for the mistake in my previous response.

However, there are other portable generators with similar power output and remote start capabilities. For example, the Westinghouse iGen2200 Portable Inverter Generator has a maximum output of 2200 watts and features a remote start capability using a key fob. Another option is the WEN 56200i Super Quiet 2000-Watt Portable Inverter Generator, which also has a maximum output of 2000 watts and features a remote start capability using a remote control.

Again, I apologize for the error in my previous response and I hope this information helps you find the generator that meets your needs.
It sounds like there aren't any in the 50 pound range with a remote start.

Yes, unfortunately, it seems that there are currently no portable generators with a TT-30R 30 amp RV outlet, a push-button start, and a weight of around 50 pounds or less. While there are several portable generators that offer one or two of these features, a combination of all three may not be currently available in the market.

The closest option might be the Champion 3100-Watt RV Ready Portable Inverter Generator that I mentioned earlier, which features a push-button start and a TT-30R 30 amp RV outlet, but weighs around 96 pounds. It is designed to be compact and portable with wheels and a folding handle for easy transportation, but it is still heavier than the weight range you mentioned.

I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and I hope this information helps you in your search for a portable generator that meets your needs.
No worries, you're being very helpful.
Thank you! I'm glad to hear that I'm being helpful. If you have any more questions or if there's anything else I can help you with, please don't hesitate to ask.
Aw man, looks like that Honda wireless remote start kit only works with 3000is.

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. You are correct that the Honda Wireless Remote Start Kit is only compatible with the Honda EU3000is generator, not the EU2200i. I apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

If you are interested in a Honda generator with remote start capabilities, you may want to consider the Honda EU3000is. It has a maximum output of 3000 watts and features a TT-30R 30 amp RV outlet. The Honda Wireless Remote Start Kit is compatible with this generator, and can be purchased separately as an accessory.

Alternatively, as I mentioned earlier, the Westinghouse iGen4500 and Generac GP2200i can also be paired with remote start kits as accessories.
Thanks for all your help so far.
You're welcome! It was my pleasure to help you. If you have any more questions or if there's anything else I can help you with, don't hesitate to ask.
Is there a small hobbyist starter motor for generic use that I can look at the specs for?

Yes, there are many small hobbyist starter motors that are available for generic use. Some common types of small starter motors include those used in model airplanes, RC cars, and small gas-powered equipment like lawnmowers and chainsaws.

The specifications for these starter motors will vary depending on the specific model and application, but some common features to look for may include:

* Voltage: Most small starter motors operate on 12 volts, although some may require higher or lower voltages depending on the application.
* Power output: Starter motor power output is typically measured in watts, and will vary depending on the specific model and application.
* Size and weight: Small starter motors are typically compact and lightweight, making them suitable for use in hobbyist applications.
* Mounting options: Some starter motors may include mounting brackets or other hardware for easy installation.

Some popular brands of small starter motors for hobbyist use include Graupner, O.S. Engines, and Hobbico, among others. You can search for these brands and others online to find a variety of options to fit your needs.
What's the average price for those starter motors?

The average price for small hobbyist starter motors can vary widely depending on the specific model, brand, and features. Generally, you can expect to pay anywhere from around $20 to $100 or more for a small hobbyist starter motor.

Less expensive starter motors may be more basic in their features and may not include mounting hardware or other accessories. More expensive starter motors may offer higher power output, greater durability, and other advanced features.

Keep in mind that prices can vary significantly depending on where you purchase the starter motor, as well as any additional shipping or handling fees that may apply. It's a good idea to compare prices from multiple sources and read reviews from other hobbyists to help you make an informed decision.
What is the most popular one of those?

There are several popular small hobbyist starter motors that are widely used in various applications. Some of the most popular brands include:

* O.S. Engines: O.S. Engines is a well-known brand of small engines and related accessories, including starter motors for RC cars and airplanes. Their starter motors are known for their high power output and durability.
* Hobbico: Hobbico is another popular brand of starter motors for hobbyist applications, offering a range of options for RC cars, planes, and other equipment. They are known for their affordability and ease of use.
* Graupner: Graupner is a German brand that produces a wide range of model airplane accessories, including starter motors. Their starter motors are known for their high-quality construction and reliability.
* Tower Hobbies: Tower Hobbies is a popular online retailer of hobbyist equipment, including starter motors for a range of applications. Their starter motors are known for their affordability and versatility.

Overall, the most popular small hobbyist starter motor will depend on the specific application and needs of the user. It's a good idea to read reviews and compare specifications from multiple brands and models to find the one that best fits your needs.
